intro: Chylismia tenuissima, commonly known as the slender chylismia, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, tubular flowers that range in color from pink to purple. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. It has small, lance-shaped leaves and produces showy inflorescences that attract pollinators like bees and butterflies. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
